entry.title: Orbx Releases Grumman TBF Avenger for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Orbx has recently released their rendition of the Grumman TBF Avenger for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. This WW2-era airplane was developed for the United States Navy and Marine Corps and eventually adopted by many air and naval aviation services worldwide. It was designed in 1940 to replace the Douglas TBD Devastator, offering an airplane that was very much in line with the technology adopted by the Axis forces at the time, in complete contrast to the Devastator, which was considered obsolete by 1939. The Avenger was designed to easily fit in aircraft carriers, with easily stowable wings that allowed way more airplanes to fit in the same carrier.Â With a maximum speed of 447 km/h, 1456km of total range, and a service ceiling of 22,600 feet, the mighty Avenger was one of the most iconic World War 2 bombers, permanently changing naval warfare.Â Crafted with Paul Bennetâs expertise (an aerobatic pilot who happens to own one of the last airworthy Avengers), the add-on features realistic aerodynamics, high-quality sounds, high-quality 3D modeling and texturing, and much more. Itâs available on OrbxDirect for roughly $17.68, requiring at least 2.23 GB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Parallel 42 Announces ChasePlane for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. Parallel 42 has recently announced that ChasePlane will soon be available for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020. They have released a video teasing this exciting new camera plugin, after releasing an initial teaser video on their social media pages which is unfortunately now gone. ChasePlane was widely recognized within the Prepar3D community and was considered a must-have tool for many flight simulation enthusiasts. Since the launch of Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020, there has been a strong demand for this plugin; however, development faced challenges due to the limitations of the original camera API. Thankfully, it appears that these issues have now been resolved, and the plugin will soon be ready for users. The teaser and announcement video revealed that the upcoming plugin will offer a fully customizable camera system for MSFS and will incorporate real physics as well as view sharing, and various modes like FlyBy and Cinematic Mode. While no specific release date or price has been provided, the video concludes with a message stating "coming soon," suggesting that the release is not far off. â We will keep you updated as more information becomes available. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned to Threshold!

entry.title: Fly2High Releases Akron-Canton Airport for MSFS 20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Fly2High has recently launched its version of Akron-Canton Airport (KCAK) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. Situated in Ohio, the airport serves the cities of Akron, Canton, Cleveland, and Massillon. Each year, the airport welcomes nearly 700.000 passengers. The airport opened in 1946, initially intended for defense purposes during World War II, although its construction was delayed. In 1948, passenger flights began operating at the airport. The first terminal was established in 1955 and underwent expansions in 1962 and 2020. Today, the airport accommodates passenger airlines such as Allegiant Air, American Eagle, Breeze Airways, and United Express, along with the cargo airline Castle Aviation. These airlines offer destinations including Chicago, Las Vegas, Los Angeles, and many more. The scenery features a highly detailed rendition of the airport, main terminal interiors, custom jetways, custom lights, and more. The newly released scenery requires 3.9 GB of disk space and is available on iniBuilds for $15.59. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned to Threshold!

entry.title: FlightFX Announces Release Date for Upcoming Piaggio Avanti II for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. FlightFX recently announced a release date for their upcoming Piaggio Avanti II for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020, along with the release of a launch trailer and pricing information. The Piaggio Avanti II is an evolution of the Piaggio Avanti, originally introduced in late 1990 after four years of flight testing. The original concept goes even further back to 1979, when engineering studies started, and design choices were tested in wind tunnels in the subsequent years by Professor Jan Roskam from the University of Kansas and Professor Gerald Gregorek from Ohio State University. The final design choice was finally made in 1982, with the fuselage development starting a year later. The first prototype only took off in 1986, with the Italian certification to come in early 1990. The Avanti II got certified in late 2005, featuring an uprated Pratt & Whitney Canada PT6A-66B turboprop engines, flying faster and more economically, and a new Rockwell Collins glass cockpit set. With 70 planes ordered in the first few months after the certification, the fastest civilian turboprop twin (according to Flying Magazine) was rather successful. The add-on promises a faithful recreation of the Piaggio Avanti II. It will be available in the MSFS Marketplace for $24.99 next Thursday (06/02).â Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news!

entry.title: UK2000 Releases University of Illinois Willard Airport for MSFS 2020/2024

UK2000 Scenery recently released their rendition of the University of Illinois Willard Airport (KCMI), serving the Urbana metropolitan area, for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020.Â While it was dedicated in late 1945, airline flights were to start nearly a decade later, in 1954, albeit in a very barebones manner, as the passenger terminal was only erected in 1960. By the late 1960s, Willard was the second-busiest airport in the state. However, it crumbled within a decade after the Airline Deregulation Act of 1978. Airlines found service to smaller airports inefficient and expensive. Airfares went up, whereas they went down at bigger airports like Chicago OâHare, quickly killing the demand and leading many airlines to leave the airport altogether. A new passenger terminal was built in the late 1980s and remains used today. Until eleven years ago, the airport was home to the University of Illinois Institute of Aviation, which was voted by trustees to be closed in 2011, and everything was transferred over to Parkland College in 2013 so that the enrolled students could complete their courses.Â Parkland College still operates the airport, providing an annual subsidy of $433,000. Itâs currently served by a single airline, American Eagle, which flies passengers to Chicago OâHare and Dallas/Fort Worth.Â The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with full-detail buildings, realistic ground markings, performance-friendly optimization, custom vegetation, PBR materials, custom static aircraft, custom night lighting, and more. Itâs available on SimMarket for roughly $14.84, requiring at least 70.42 MB of free hard disk space to install. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: IM Scenery Releases RAF Honington for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. IM Scenery recently released their rendition of RAF Honington (EGXH), a Royal Air Force station in Suffolk, England, for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024.Â Construction started in 1935 and was undertaken by John Laing & Son, an investment group now known as John Laing Group, which boasts 177 years of history. The opening occurred two years later, nearly right in time for the beginning of World War 2. Based in Honington at the start of the war, the IX Squadron ran the first British bombing raid of the Second World War, attacking the Kriegsmarine in the Baltic. In 1942, the airfield was transferred to the United States Army Air Forces and upgraded to a class A Bomber base. It was eventually transferred back to the RAF once the war was over, primarily utilized by the RAF Transport Command and later by the RAF Bomber Command in 1949. In the 1950s, a 9,000 ft concrete runway was built and completed in 1956. In the 1980s, it was selected to become a base for the RAFâs Panavia Tornado fleet, with the IX Squadron being reformed there and becoming the worldâs first operational Tornado squadron. â In mid-1992, it was decided that Honington would become an RAF Regiment Depot, with the Tornado fleet wholly leaving the airport. â The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with fully custom objects with PBR textures, custom night lighting, custom ground poly, custom terraforming, and custom static aircraft. Itâs available on Contrail for roughly $8.30, requiring at least 712.1 MB of free hard disk space to install.Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Parallel 42 Publishes Introduction to ChasePlane for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. Parallel 42 has recently published a blog article providing more information on their recently announced ChasePlane plugin for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020, covering its features, MSFS 2024 compatibility info, and lots of in-game footage. They start by mentioning that their teaser was only teasing the cinematics system, which is one of the possibilities offered by their new product: switching effortlessly between cockpit view, external angles, and even airport cameras if you so desire. Custom presets can be easily created and shared online with seamless bind controls. â For the unfamiliar, ChasePlane was originally released in 2016 for Microsoft Flight Simulator X, later being made compatible with Prepar3d and rapidly becoming the de facto camera application for ESP-based simulators at the time. It would only be natural for them to develop it for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 when that came about, but technical limitations have made that impossible until very recently, which is why itâs only a thing now, almost five years after the simulatorâs release.Â â ChasePlane will initially be released for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 only, but they do have Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 in mind and already have a working build, albeit unstable due to the simulatorâs very early nature. That makes it hard for them to commit to a public release, as an update could break everything. âWe canât afford to waste time chasing a moving target,â concluded Edson Soriano, Parallel 42âs Managing Director. Due to platform limitations, ChasePlane will not be compatible with Xbox.Â â The add-on will feature a highly realistic physics-based camera behavior based on extensive research and real-world pilot footage, warranting realistic motion that dynamically responds to the environment, embracing the flight model rather than altering it. Pilots can feel the vibration during the take-off roll, the rush of turbulence, and the fluid shifts during maneuvers. They have embedded videos demonstrating the camera system on the ârealisticâ preset with different aircraft and conditions. Users can adjust the settings regarding intensities, etc., with sliders. The complete feature list for the product follows below: â They have not yet been able to provide information on a potential release date or pricing, but itâs said to be coming soon. â Parallel 42 is ensuring the software is stable through extensive beta testing, ensuring itâs launched in a relatively solid state, thus creating a smooth sailing experience for the customers. entry.title: Astralis Studios Previews Region of Waterloo International for MSFS 2020
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. Astralis Studios has recently showcased their upcoming Region of Waterloo International Airport (CYKF) for Microsoft Flight Simulator. This airport serves Kitchener-Waterloo and surrounding areas seeing 118,541 aircraft movements in 2018. The airport was opened in 1930 and was used mainly for flight instruction. At the end of World War 2 there was a push for a larger and more appropriate place for private and commercial aviation in the area. In 1948, the Waterloo-Wellington Airport Commission acquired a larger site in the Breslau area and a new airfield was completed there in 1950. The then K-W Municipal Airport became a general aviation facility in 1969. Today, it is served by airlines such as WestJet, Sunwing, and Flair Airlines. Non-stop commercial flights from Waterloo include destinations such as Calgary, Vancouver, Cancun, Halifax and more. In addition to commercial traffic, the airport is a popular general aviation hub and is home to the second largest flight training centre in Canada, Waterloo Wellington Flight Centre, as well as a plethora of privately owned hangars. This scenery includes over 60 custom objects, custom ground markings, enhanced night lighting as well as PBR texturing. It will be released on February 6th and will be available for $15.99 on all platforms. â Stay tuned to Threshold for all of your flight simulation news!

entry.title: SiamFlight Releases Phuket International Airport for MSFS 2020

Built in 1988 to accommodate only 6.5 million passengers yearly, it operated nearly at capacity for almost 30 years, until a new expansion project brought the figures to 20 million passengers per year (12.5 million passengers on the new terminal, 6.5 on the old one). It currently has three terminals: Terminal 2 handles international flights, Terminal 3 handles domestic operations, and Terminal X exclusively handles charters.
